meanings.definition: The edge or border of a piece of cloth, especially when folded over and sewn.
meanings.sent1: She carefully sewed the hem of her dress to make it shorter.
meanings.sent2: The tailor added a beautiful lace hem to the skirt.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten played with the hem of the tablecloth, causing it to unravel.
meanings.sent4: The hem of the ocean kissed the sandy shore gently.
meanings.sent5: The hem of the flag fluttered proudly in the wind.

meanings.definition: To make a hem on a piece of clothing.
meanings.sent1: Mom taught me how to hem my pants to the right length.
meanings.sent2: I need to hem this skirt before the party tonight.
meanings.sent3: The tailor will hem your dress in no time.
meanings.sent4: She decided to hem the curtains to match the new carpet.
meanings.sent5: I will hem the edges of the fabric to prevent fraying.

meanings.definition: A sound made when clearing the throat.
meanings.sent1: He let out a small hem before beginning his speech.
meanings.sent2: The quiet classroom was interrupted by a sudden hem.
meanings.sent3: The hem from the back row caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent4: The hem echoed in the silent room, breaking the tension.
meanings.sent5: Her hem was so loud that it startled the cat nearby.
